sentences.english: The shipyard is within 5km of shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 這個船廠離上海5公里以內。

sentences.english: The ship was launched at Odense Steel Shipyard Ltd in May 2007.
sentences.chinese: 這船是丹麥的歐登賽鋼鐵船廠建造的。

sentences.english: You'll have to assault the boatyard and kill everyone there.
sentences.chinese: 您將有毆打該船廠和殺害人人有。

sentences.english: Eventually the heirs pay the yard to have it towed off and junked.
sentences.chinese: 最後繼承舊船的人還得付錢給船廠把它們拖走和廢棄。

sentences.english: The gyro isn't up to standard. Please give us a certificate so that we can make a claim on the shipyard.
sentences.chinese: 羅經達不到標準，請給我們出具證明以便向船廠索賠。

sentences.english: Boatyards around the country hold thousands of old boats no one will ever buy.
sentences.chinese: 全國的船廠有着成千艘無人問津的舊船。

sentences.english: Bicycles are the most common mode of transportation for shipyard workers.
sentences.chinese: 自行車是船廠工人最主要的交通工具。

sentences.english: The Shipyard has pioneered an environmentally safe method of deactivating and recycling nuclear-powered ships.
sentences.chinese: 造船廠，摸索了環境安全的方法再造失核動力船舶。

sentences.english: And there were strikes in the shipyards, the shoe factories and the telephone companies.
sentences.chinese: 並有在船廠，鞋子工廠和電話公司的罷工。

sentences.english: A new-type ocean-going freighter is being laid down at that ship yard.
sentences.chinese: 一艘新型的遠洋貨輪正在那家船廠建造。

sentences.english: She started of working as translator in a shipping company and moved on to Human Resource and Sales in Tomson.
sentences.chinese: 她的職業生涯開始於上海船廠的高級翻譯工作。

sentences.english: The work was interesting and the shipyard was huge.
sentences.chinese: 工作很有意思，而且造船廠很大。
這個廠定名爲東風造船廠。

sentences.english: The shipyard will launch the new boat next week.
sentences.chinese: 造船廠將於下週讓新船下水。

sentences.english: Legend has it the name came from East Coast shipyard workers.
sentences.chinese: 傳說潛艇三明治的名稱出自東海岸造船廠工人。

sentences.english: Steel ladders and pedals shall be provided in the water tanks and oil tanks according to the shipyard's standard.
sentences.chinese: 根據船廠標準，水艙和油艙安裝鋼質梯子和踏步。

definition: to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
domain/territory under one's control/foundation of a building/base of operations/crust of earth
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
